title: ICE: Switch on discriminant of non-ADT (running cargo clippy)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This did not happe the first time I ran `cargo clippy`, but every subsequent time.
### Code

https://github.com/openanalytics/s3-algo/tree/ice
This tag.

### Meta
```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.41.1 (f3e1a954d 2020-02-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: f3e1a954d2ead4e2fc197c7da7d71e6c61bad196
commit-date: 2020-02-24
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.41.1
LLVM version: 9.0
```

### Error output

```
$ cargo clippy
    Checking s3-algo v0.1.14 (/home/erlend/code/s3-algo)
warning: unused variable: `config`
  --> src/list_actions.rs:26:31
   |
26 |         let ListObjects { s3, config, bucket, stream } = self;
   |                               ^^^^^^ help: try ignoring the field: `config: _`
   |
   = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default

error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/dataflow/generic/engine.rs:315: Switch on discriminant of non-ADT

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:881:9

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/new

note: Clippy version: clippy 0.0.212 (fc5d0cc 2020-02-24)

query stack during panic:
#0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `s3-algo`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
